Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers have beaten the Warriors 136 to 117 in their last meeting.
The Warriors are scoring the 16th most points per game but are allowing the 10th fewest.
The Cavaliers are allowing the 12th fewest points per game but scoring the 2nd most per game (122.7).
The Warriors have been cold of late, dropping 7 of their last 10 games (shooting 42.7%).
The Cavaliers continue to roll, winning 9 of their last 10 (shooting 49.7%).
The Cavaliers team is fully healthy and expected to perform well.
The Cavaliers can score in multiple ways, including midrange and outside shots from Mitchell and Garland, and inside play from Mobley and Allen.
